text: Finally, we must provide states with the resources they need to administer the vote and to keep poll workers safe. That means at least $4 billion for election administration, conditioned on states adopting specific measures that will protect voters and reduce barriers to voting.

Senator Rubio issued the following statement after @POTUS announced his Administration will withhold funds to the @WHO.

Many voters – including voters of color, low-income voters, & voters with disabilities – may have obstacles to participating from home. States should keep in-person Election Day voting & provide at least 30 days of early voting with social distancing & sanitation guidelines.

The likely need to replenish funds for #PPP was well understood by all during negotiations. 

It’s why our bipartisan group that crafted it asked for more money.

For the sake of millions of #SmallBusinesses I hope Congress can act quickly & without unnecessary horse trading.

The fear that #PPP will run out of money is creating tremendous anxiety among #SmallBusiness. 

We have days, NOT weeks to address this.  

We are working with @USTreasury to make a formal request for additional funds ASAP & with Senate leadership to get fast track vote ASAP.

Congress should also mandate that states waive absentee ballot requirements that undermine social distancing – like sending in copies of their ID or including a notary or witness signature with their ballot.

Coronavirus has exposed the conditions under which too many Americans work every day.

We need stronger unions.
We need to raise the wage.
We need safer work conditions.
We need health care for all.
We need paid leave.

Not just during this crisis—always.
